summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York staff discussing public statements about evidence found in Jeffrey Epstein's safe, including diamonds, a passport, and pictures of underaged girls. The emails confirm these items were referenced in court filings and arguments.

persons.name: Margolin, James
persons.context: Recipient of email chain discussing evidence disclosures; appears to be part of the U.S. Attorney's Office public affairs team.

persons.name: Biase, Nicholas
persons.context: Author of initial email asking whether it was publicly stated that diamonds and a passport were found in the same safe as pictures of underaged girls.

connections.description: Both appear to be staff members at the U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, communicating about public statements regarding evidence in the Epstein case.

events.title: Court filing referencing evidence
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office filed a document referencing photos/discs found in Epstein's safe.

events.title: Court argument referencing evidence
events.description: Prosecutors referenced diamonds and a passport found in Epstein's safe during a court argument.

keyFacts: Evidence found in Jeffrey Epstein's safe included diamonds, a passport, and pictures of underaged girls.
The U.S. Attorney's Office publicly referenced the photos/discs in a July 12, 2019 filing and the diamonds and passport in a July 15, 2019 court argument.
At least some of the images of underaged girls were stored in the same safe as the diamonds and passport.
